name: Release Plan
description: Release Plan to be performed during the release itself

tests.name: Version Bump: Version number
tests.description: For the Avocado versioning, two files need to receive a manual version update: `VERSION` and `python-avocado.spec`.

tests.name: Version Bump: Propagate to plugins
tests.description: Run the command: `make propagate-version` to propagate this change to all optional and “linkable” plugins sharing the parent dir (eg. avocado-vt).

tests.name: Write the release notes
tests.description: Under `docs/source/releases/` create a new .rst file describing the release changes. Also, update the `docs/source/releases/index.rst` file.  Look at the sprint issues and PRs on GitHub, specially the ones with the `comment-on-sprint-review` label.

tests.name: Version Bump: Commit the bump
tests.description: Commit the version bump, python-avocado.spec and release notes. Don't forget to commit the changes of 'linked' plugins as they live in different repositories.

tests.name: Version Bump: Tag the repository
tests.description: Tagging the repository locally (but not pushing it yet), will let you do a `make rpm-release` in the next step. Run `git tag -u $(GPG_ID) -s $(RELEASE) -m 'Release $(RELEASE)'`

tests.name: Build RPMs
tests.description:
Go to the source directory and do:

`make rpm-release && echo $?`

This should be all. It will build packages using mock, targeting your default configuration. That usually means the same platform you’re currently on. Also make sure it builds on other supported distros, by setting the MOCK_CONFIG variable to values such as `epel-8-x86_64`.

tests.name: Version Bump: Push the tag
tests.description:
The tag should be pushed to the GIT repository with:

`git push --tags`

tests.name: Upload package to PyPI
tests.description:
Users may also want to get Avocado from the PyPI repository, so please upload there as well. To help with the process, please run:

`make pypi`

And follow the URL and brief instructions given.

tests.name: Configure Read The Docs
tests.description:
Visit the link below:

https://readthedocs.org/dashboard/avocado-framework/edit/

 1) Click in *Versions*. Under *Activate a Version*, find the version you're releasing and click the *Activate* button;
 2) Click in *Admin*. Under *Advanced Settings*/*Global settings*/*Default Version*, select the new version you're releasing. Click the *Save* button at the bottom of the page.

tests.name: Update the Fedora and EPEL RPM packages and module
tests.description:
Follow the instructions on:

https://avocado-framework.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/contributor/chapters/releasing.html#how-to-refresh-fedora-epel-modules

and work with the package maintainer by sending a PR to update the Avocado version on the `avocado:latest` stream.

tests.name: Send e-emails
tests.description: Send the e-email with the release notes to avocado-devel and virt-test-devel.
